Transcription for 14200

Landshut Major Coast Guard Training
In the bottom meadow nearest to the beach at Landshut Major,
there used to be a pole with cross arms attached to it,
which represented a ship's mast.
This was used by the Coast Guards to practise rescue procedures.
One end of a rope was attached to the pole,
a Boatswain's chair would be fitted onto the rope,
and the other end of the rope would be connected to a tripod
and pegged down to the ground.
The children of Landshut Major had great fun,
racing up from the beach to see who could be the first to climb to the top of the pole.
